sen.j: 堺浦の戦い（さかいうらのたたかい）は、和泉国堺浦（現在の大阪府堺市）にて行われた戦いのこと。
sen.e: The Battle of Sakaiura is a battle fought in Sakaiura, Izumi Province (present-day Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture).
The Battle of Sakaiura is a battle fought in Sakaiura, Izumi Province (present-day Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture).
The Battle of Sakaiura is a battle fought in Sakaiura, Izumi Province (present-day Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture).

sen.j: 堺浜の戦い（さかいはまのたたかい）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called the Battle of Sakaihama.
It is also called the Battle of Sakaihama.
It is also called the Battle of Sakaihama.

sen.j: 歴史的に著名な戦いは2回ある。
sen.e: The battle includes two actions which are historically notable.
There are two battles which are historically notable.
There are two battles which are historically notable.

sen.j: 延元3年/暦応元年（1338年）に、北朝 (日本)（室町幕府）方高師直と南朝 (日本)方北畠顕家との間で戦われた戦いについては、石津の戦いを参照のこと。
sen.e: For the battle fought between KO no Moronao of the Northern Court and Akiie KITABATAKE of the Southern Court in 1338, refer to the Battle of Ishizu.

For the details on the battle fought between KO no Moronao of the Northern Court (Japan) (the Muromachi shogunate) and Akiie KITABATAKE of the Southern Court (Japan) in 1338, refer to the Battle of Ishizu.
sen.cmt: (日本)(室町幕府)の訳を追加For → For details on
sen.e: For the details on the battle fought between KO no Moronao of the Northern Court (Japan) (the Muromachi shogunate) and Akiie KITABATAKE of the Southern Court (Japan) in 1338, refer to the Battle of Ishizu.

sen.j: 応永6年（1399年）に、室町幕府と守護大名大内義弘との間で戦われた戦いについては、応永の乱を参照のこと。
sen.e: For the battle fought between the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and Yoshihiro OUCHI, who was a shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) in 1399, refer to the Oei War.

For details on the battle fought between the Muromachi shogunate and Yoshihiro OUCHI, who was a shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) in 1399, refer to the Oei War.
sen.cmt: the Muromachi bakufu → the Muromachi shogunate(Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)を削除。For → For details on
sen.e: For details on the battle fought between the Muromachi shogunate and Yoshihiro OUCHI, who was a shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) in 1399, refer to the Oei War.
